pr_title: Fixes problems with managing external file types (issue 5846)

timeline.message:
- edit/customize external file types: radio button for "default program"/"custom program" fixed: it now gets updated properly (binding added);
- "Edit file type dialog": correct value get loaded now for the input field "Name"
- when storing an updated file type: no differentiation will be made any more whether program runs on Windows or somewhere else
- quick fix for pending issue: editing an ExternalFileType works now (still room for improvement); visual bug concerning "lazy" update of table could be a Linux issue, since other tables are affected as well; so basically - except the "lazy" update thing -- everything works concerning external file types

- edit/customize external file types: radio button for "default program"/"custom program" fixed: it now gets updated properly (binding added);

- when storing an updated file type: no differentiation will be made any more whether program runs on Windows or somewhere else

timeline.bodyText:
Custom application selected is always the opposite of default application, right?
I guess the problem is that the toggle group is defined locally

  
    
      jabref/src/main/java/org/jabref/gui/externalfiletype/EditExternalFileTypeEntryDialog.fxml
    
    
         Line 38
      in
      d0393b5
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <ToggleGroup fx:id="applicationToggleGroup" /> 
        
    
  


and not globally as in

  
    
      jabref/src/main/java/org/jabref/gui/preferences/EntryEditorTab.fxml
    
    
        Lines 14 to 17
      in
      d0393b5
    
    
    
    

        
          
           <fx:define> 
        

        
          
               <ToggleGroup fx:id="nameFormat"/> 
        

        
          
               <ToggleGroup fx:id="firstNames"/> 
        

        
          
           </fx:define> 
        
    
  


If this does not work, then you can also try
customApplication.selectedProperty().bind(viewModel.defaultApplicationSelectedProperty().not());
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

You always need to work around that.
Just look how it's done in the settings dialog
